column4: short question: what do i need to run x-dependent applications on a computer, over an SSH-tunnel? I want to use computer X to run x-programs at computers Y's screen through SSH.
(but i dont have to use the -X flag when i log into my school)
what should the $DISPLAY be set to?
oh i forgot about the -X flag
ok, i was experimenting with lots of values before.. localhost:10.0, 11.0 et.c..
when i use the -X flag, i still get the old error
and $DISPLAY is not set to anything :(
i -dont- want to install lots of useless packets.. ubuntu-desktop would perhaps do it, but there are trillions of useless programs there
use privoxy <-> tor/i2p <-> google and erase cookies and stuff each time. that works :)
i dont have x11r6 installed. do i really need the x server to run graphics on -other- computers?
yes u do. Even the graphics is shown on another computer, the code is still executed there
